messages.subject: Re: street views up on Google Maps for Japan
messages.msgSnippet: People may find this map (still downloadable large file) to be helpful as a guide if they want to try to use the google satellite feature:
messages.messageBody:
People may find this map (still downloadable large file) to be helpful as a
guide if they want to try to use the google satellite feature:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/SHQ/message/3317

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: street views up on Google Maps for Japan
messages.msgSnippet: yeah my computer been slowing down a bit too ... From: secretary  Subject: [SHQ] Re: street views up on Google Maps for Japan To:
messages.messageBody:
yeah my computer been slowing down a bit too

--- On Wed, 8/6/08, secretary <secretarytocapt3@...> wrote:
From: secretary <secretarytocapt3@...>
Subject: [SHQ] Re: street views up on Google Maps for Japan
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Date: Wednesday, August 6, 2008, 11:01 AM











Leave it to spiritus saitou to find the ultimate online time killer.



My desktop was able to see a truck backing up out of a parking lot

though. Then my system sort of slowed down alot.



I bet if this was available a few years we could drop down into Kyoto

and see gift shops full of Shinsengumi merchandise.



Technology is soooo scary!



(^_^)





























[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] street views up on Google Maps for Japan
messages.msgSnippet: Okay, so I used the rich text editor to write the post and the link ends up being written out twice.  Mea culpa.  The links are the same and both go to the
messages.messageBody:
Okay, so I used the rich text editor to write the post and the link ends up being written out twice.  Mea culpa.  The links are the same and both go to the same page.

--- On Tue, 8/5/08, spiritus_saitou <spiritus_saitou@...> wrote:
From: spiritus_saitou <spiritus_saitou@...>
Subject: [SHQ] street views up on Google Maps for Japan
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, August 5, 2008, 8:47 PM











Admittedly, I haven't spent much time with this yet, but thought I'd

pass it along to those who are explorers at heart and, like me, can't

afford to fly across the bigger pond to Japan.



I think Google may have this going for other cities in the world. Well,

now they have it up for the Tokyo area, Kyoto/Osaka/ Kobe, Sendai,

Hakodate, Otaru & Sapporo. The little camera icons on the map show

where there are street views available. Once you're on a street level

map, whenever you click on a point on that map, it'll take you to that

point visually.



http://maps. google.com/ maps?f=q& hl=en&geocode= &q=&layer= c&ie=UTF8& ll=38.\

255436,138.713379& spn=8.605754, 16.962891& z=6

<http://maps. google.com/ maps?f=q& hl=en&geocode= &q=&layer= c&ie=UTF8& ll=38\

.255436,138. 713379&spn= 8.605754, 16.962891& z=6>



Can anyone find any points of interest related to the Shinsengumi? :P



phil



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]





























[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Admittedly, I haven't spent much time with this yet, but thought I'd
pass it along to those who are explorers at heart and, like me, can't
afford to fly across the bigger pond to Japan.

I think Google may have this going for other cities in the world. Well,
now they have it up for the Tokyo area, Kyoto/Osaka/Kobe, Sendai,
Hakodate, Otaru & Sapporo. The little camera icons on the map show
where there are street views available. Once you're on a street level
map, whenever you click on a point on that map, it'll take you to that
point visually.

http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=&layer=c&ie=UTF8&ll=38.\
255436,138.713379&spn=8.605754,16.962891&z=6
<http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=&layer=c&ie=UTF8&ll=38\
.255436,138.713379&spn=8.605754,16.962891&z=6>

Can anyone find any points of interest related to the Shinsengumi? :P

phil
